  1from typing import List, Tuple

  3from game.chicken import Chicken

  5    Direction,

  9    loc_after_direction,

 11from game.game_map import GameMap
 12from game.history import History
 13
 14
 15def manhattan_distance(p1: Tuple[int, int], p2: Tuple[int, int]) -> int:
 16    return abs(p1[0] - p2[0]) + abs(p1[1] - p2[1])
 17
 18
 19class Board:
 20    """
 21    Board is the representation of the state of the match. It contains
 22    only the state known to the player -- undiscovered trapdoors are not
 23    included in the Board (although found ones are).
 24
 25    Any coordinates should be given to the board in the form of x, y.
 26
 27    Check_validity is on by default for most functions, but slows
 28    down execution. If a player is confident their actions are valid,
 29    they can directly apply turns and moves with check_validity as false.
 30
 31    Be wary that invalid actions/turns could lead to functions throwing
 32    errors, so make sure to handle them with a try/except in case so that
 33    your program doesn't crash. If an apply function throws an error,
 34    it is not guarenteed that the board state will be valid or that the state
 35    will be the same as when the function started.
 36    """
 37
 38    def __init__(
 39        self,
 40        game_map: GameMap,
 41        time_to_play: float = 20,
 42        build_history: bool = False,
 43        copy: bool = False,
 44    ):
 45        """
 46        Initializes the board with the specified game map and configuration options.
 47
 48        Parameters:
 49            game_map (game_map.GameMap): The map representing the game environment.
 50            time_to_play (float, optional): The time limit for the game in seconds. Defaults to 20.
 51            build_history (bool, optional): Whether to track the history of the game. Defaults to False.
 52            copy (bool, optional): Whether to initialize a copy of the game game_map. Defaults to False.
 53        """
 54
 55        self.game_map = game_map
 56
 57        if not copy:
 58            self.eggs_player = set()
 59            self.eggs_enemy = set()
 60            self.turds_player = set()
 61            self.turds_enemy = set()
 62
 63            # These will get their initial positions and even-ness
 64            # from the gameplay
 65            self.chicken_player = Chicken(self.game_map.MAX_TURDS)
 66            self.chicken_enemy = Chicken(self.game_map.MAX_TURDS)
 67
 68            self.found_trapdoors = set()
 69
 70            # game metadata
 71            self.turn_count = 0
 72
 73            self.MAX_TURNS = 40
 74            self.turns_left_player = self.MAX_TURNS
 75            self.turns_left_enemy = self.MAX_TURNS
 76
 77            # more game metadata
 78            self.winner = None
 79
 80            self.time_to_play = time_to_play
 81            self.player_time = time_to_play
 82            self.enemy_time = time_to_play
 83            self.win_reason = None
 84
 85            self.chicken_blocked = False
 86            self.is_as_turn = True
 87
 88            # history building
 89            self.build_history = build_history
 90            if build_history:
 91                self.history = History()
 92
 93    def is_valid_cell(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
 94        """
 95        Checks if the given coordinates are within the valid board boundaries.
 96
 97        Parameters:
 98            (x, y): The location to check.
 99
100        Returns:
101            (bool): True if the cell is valid, False otherwise.
102        """
103        return (
104            loc[0] >= 0
105            and loc[1] >= 0
106            and loc[0] < self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
107            and loc[1] < self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
108        )
109
110    def is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
111        """
112        Checks if a specific cell is within the enemy's turd zone.
113
114        Parameters:
115            loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.
116
117        Returns:
118            (bool): True if the cell is within the enemy's turd zone, False otherwise.
119        """
120        for dir in Direction:
121            new_loc = loc_after_direction(loc, dir)
122            if new_loc in self.turds_enemy:
123                return True
124        if loc in self.turds_enemy:
125            return True
126
127        return False
128
129    def is_cell_blocked(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
130        """
131        Checks if a specific cell is blocked for the given player.
132
133        Parameters:
134            loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.
135
136        Returns:
137            (bool): True if the cell is blocked or occupied by the enemy chicken, False otherwise.
138        """
139        if not self.is_valid_cell(loc):
140            return True
141
142        enemy_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
143        if enemy_loc == loc:
144            return True
145
146        if loc in self.eggs_enemy:
147            return True
148
149        if self.is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(loc):
150            return True
151
152        return False
153
154    def is_valid_direction(self, dir: Direction | int):
155        """
156        Checks if a direction is valid for the given player.
157
158        Parameters:
159            dir (Direction | int): The direction to check.
160
161        Returns:
162            (bool): True if the direction is valid, False otherwise.
163        """
164
165        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
166        next_loc = loc_after_direction(my_loc, dir)
167        return not self.is_cell_blocked(next_loc)
168
169    def is_valid_move(
170        self, dir: Direction | int, move_type: MoveType | int, enemy: bool = False
171    ):
172        """
173        Checks if a move is valid for the given player.
174
175        Parameters:
176            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
177            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
178
179        Returns:
180            (bool): True if the move is valid, False otherwise.
181        """
182
183        if enemy:
184            if move_type == MoveType.TURD and self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left() <= 0:
185                return False
186            test_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
187            opposing_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
188            even_chicken = self.chicken_enemy.even_chicken
189
190        else:
191            if move_type == MoveType.TURD and self.chicken_player.get_turds_left() <= 0:
192                return False
193            test_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
194            opposing_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
195            even_chicken = self.chicken_player.even_chicken
196
197        # Wrong parity?
198        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
199            if (test_loc[0] + test_loc[1]) % 2 != even_chicken:
200                return False
201
202        # Where would it end up?
203        new_loc = loc_after_direction(test_loc, dir)
204
205        # Would that put the chickens on top of each other?
206        if new_loc == opposing_loc:
207            return False
208
209        # Is it off the board?
210        if (
211            new_loc[0] < 0
212            or new_loc[1] < 0
213            or new_loc[0] >= self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
214            or new_loc[1] >= self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
215        ):
216            return False
217
218        # Opposing eggs?
219        if enemy:
220            if new_loc in self.eggs_player:
221                return False
222        else:
223            if new_loc in self.eggs_enemy:
224                return False
225
226        # Opposing turds?
227        if enemy:
228            problematic_turds = self.turds_player
229        else:
230            problematic_turds = self.turds_enemy
231
232        for direction in Direction:
233            adjacent_loc = loc_after_direction(new_loc, direction)
234            if adjacent_loc in problematic_turds:
235                return False
236
237        # Plain move is fine
238        if move_type == MoveType.PLAIN:
239            return True
240
241        # Is anything belonging to the same player already in the square?
242        if enemy:
243            if test_loc in self.eggs_enemy:
244                return False
245            if test_loc in self.turds_enemy:
246                return False
247        else:
248            if test_loc in self.eggs_player:
249                return False
250            if test_loc in self.turds_player:
251                return False
252
253        # If it is an egg laying, we are good to go
254        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
255            return True
256
257        if manhattan_distance(test_loc, opposing_loc) < 2:
258            return False
259
260        return True
261
262    def get_valid_moves(self, enemy: bool = False) -> List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]:
263        """
264        Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.
265
266        Parameters:
267            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.
268
269        Returns:
270            (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.
271        """
272        valid_moves = []
273        for dir in Direction:
274            for move_type in MoveType:
275                if self.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, enemy=enemy):
276                    valid_moves.append((dir, move_type))
277
278        return valid_moves
279
280    def can_lay_egg(self):
281        """
282        Checks if the player can lay an egg at their current location.
283
284        Parameters:
285
286        Returns:
287            (bool): True if an egg can be laid, False otherwise.
288        """
289
290        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
291        return self.can_lay_egg_at_loc(my_loc)
292
293    def can_lay_egg_at_loc(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]):
294        """
295        Checks if the player can lay an egg at a specific location.
296
297        Parameters:
298            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
299            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
300
301        Returns:
302            (bool): True if an egg can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
303        """
304
305        return (
306            self.chicken_player.can_lay_egg(loc)
307            and loc not in self.eggs_player
308            and loc not in self.turds_player
309            and loc not in self.turds_enemy
310        )
311
312    def can_lay_turd(self):
313        """
314        Checks if the player can lay a turd at their current location.
315
316
317        Returns:
318            (bool): True if a turd can be laid, False otherwise.
319        """
320
321        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
322        return self.can_lay_turd_at_loc(my_loc)
323
324    def can_lay_turd_at_loc(self, loc):
325        """
326        Checks if the player can lay a turd at a specific location.
327
328        Parameters:
329            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
330            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
331
332        Returns:
333            (bool): True if a turd can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
334        """
335        enemy_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
336        return (
337            self.chicken_player.has_turds_left()
338            and manhattan_distance(loc, enemy_loc) > 1
339            and loc not in self.turds_player
340            and loc not in self.turds_enemy
341            and loc not in self.eggs_player
342            and loc not in self.eggs_enemy
343        )
344
345    def apply_move(
346        self,
347        dir: Direction | int,
348        move_type: MoveType | int,
349        timer: float = 0,
350        check_ok: bool = True,
351    ):
352        """
353        Applies a move to the board for the specified player.
354
355        Parameters:
356            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
357            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
358            timer (float, optional): Time taken for the move in seconds. Defaults to 0.
359            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.
360
361        Returns:
362            (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.
363        """
364        # TODO: put in try/except
365        # try:
366
367        if check_ok:
368            if not self.is_valid_move(dir, move_type):
369                return False
370
371        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
372        offset = 0 if self.is_as_turn else 2
373
374        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
375            if (my_loc[0] == 0 or my_loc[0] == self.game_map.MAP_SIZE - 1) and (
376                my_loc[1] == 0 or my_loc[1] == self.game_map.MAP_SIZE - 1
377            ):
378                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid(self.game_map.CORNER_REWARD)
379            else:
380                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid()
381            self.eggs_player.add(my_loc)
382
383        elif move_type == MoveType.TURD:
384            self.chicken_player.decrement_turds()
385            self.turds_player.add(my_loc)
386
387        new_loc = self.chicken_player.apply_dir(dir)
388
389        self.end_turn(move_type, timer)
390
391        return True
392        # except:
393        #     return False
394
395    def end_turn(self, move_type: MoveType, timer=0):
396        """
397        Ends the current turn and updates game state.
398
399        Parameters:
400            move_type (MoveType): The type of move that was made.
401            timer (float, optional): Time taken for the turn in seconds. Defaults to 0.
402        """
403        self.turn_count += 1
404        self.turns_left_player -= 1
405        
406        self.player_time -= timer
407
408        if not self.has_moves_left(enemy=True):
409            if self.turns_left_enemy > 0:
410                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid(2)
411                self.chicken_blocked = True
412
413        self.check_win()
414
415        if self.build_history:
416            self.history.record_round_update(
417                self.chicken_player.get_location(),
418                move_type,
419                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid(),
420                self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid(),
421                self.chicken_player.get_turds_left(),
422                self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left(),
423                self.player_time,
424                self.enemy_time,
425                self.turns_left_player,
426                self.turns_left_enemy,
427                self.is_as_turn,
428            )
429            
430        self.is_as_turn = not self.is_as_turn
431
432    def check_win(self, timeout_bounds: float = 0.5):
433        """
434        Checks if the game has been won and sets the winner accordingly.
435
436        Parameters:
437            timeout_bounds (float, optional): The time threshold in seconds for determining timeout ties. Defaults to 0.5.
438        """
439        if self.player_time <= 0:
440            if self.enemy_time <= timeout_bounds:
441                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
442            else:
443                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
444        elif self.enemy_time <= 0:
445            if self.player_time <= timeout_bounds:
446                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
447            else:
448                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
449        elif self.turns_left_player == 0 and self.turns_left_enemy == 0:
450            if self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() < self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid():
451                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
452            elif (
453                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() > self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
454            ):
455                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
456            else:
457                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
458        elif self.chicken_blocked:
459            # seperate condition in case we want to change outcome of blocking win
460            if self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() < self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid():
461                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
462            elif (
463                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() > self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
464            ):
465                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
466            else:
467                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
468
469    def is_game_over(self):
470        """
471        Checks if the game is over.
472
473        Returns:
474            (bool): True if the game is over, False otherwise.
475        """
476        return self.winner is not None
477
478    def forecast_move(
479        self,
480        dir: Direction | int,
481        move_type: MoveType | int,
482        check_ok: bool = True,
483    ):
484        """
485        Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.
486
487        Parameters:
488            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
489            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
490            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.
491
492        Returns:
493            (Board): A new Board object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.
494        """
495        board_copy = self.get_copy()
496        ok = board_copy.apply_move(dir, move_type, check_ok)
497        return board_copy if ok else None
498
499    def set_found_trapdoors(self, found_trapdoors):
500        """
501        Sets a trapdoor at the specified location and updates sampling masks if randomization is enabled.
502
503        Parameters:
504            x (int): The x-coordinate for the trapdoor.
505            y (int): The y-coordinate for the trapdoor.
506        """
507        self.found_trapdoors = set(found_trapdoors)
508
509    def get_copy(
510        self,
511        build_history: bool = False,
512        asymmetric: bool = False,
513    ):
514        """
515        Creates a deep copy of the current board.
516
517        Parameters:
518            build_history (bool, optional): Whether the copy should track history. Defaults to False.
519
520        Returns:
521            (Board): A new Board object with the same state as the current one.
522        """
523        board_copy = Board(self.game_map, build_history=build_history, copy=True)
524
525        board_copy.eggs_player = self.eggs_player.copy()
526        board_copy.eggs_enemy = self.eggs_enemy.copy()
527        board_copy.turds_player = self.turds_player.copy()
528        board_copy.turds_enemy = self.turds_enemy.copy()
529        board_copy.found_trapdoors = self.found_trapdoors.copy()
530        board_copy.is_as_turn = self.is_as_turn
531
532        board_copy.chicken_player = self.chicken_player.get_copy()
533        board_copy.chicken_enemy = self.chicken_enemy.get_copy()
534
535        # game metadata
536        board_copy.turn_count = self.turn_count
537
538        board_copy.MAX_TURNS = self.MAX_TURNS
539        board_copy.turns_left_player = self.turns_left_player
540        board_copy.turns_left_enemy = self.turns_left_enemy
541
542        # more game metadata
543        board_copy.winner = self.winner
544
545        board_copy.time_to_play = self.time_to_play
546        board_copy.player_time = self.player_time
547        board_copy.enemy_time = self.enemy_time
548        board_copy.win_reason = self.win_reason
549        board_copy.chicken_blocked = self.chicken_blocked
550
551        # history building
552        board_copy.build_history = build_history
553        if build_history:
554            board_copy.history = self.history
555
556        return board_copy
557
558    def has_moves_left(self, enemy=False):
559        """
560        Checks if the player has any valid moves remaining.
561
562        Returns:
563            (bool): True if there are valid moves remaining, False otherwise.
564        """
565
566        return len(self.get_valid_moves(enemy=enemy)) > 0
567
568    def set_build_history(self, build_history: bool):
569        """
570        Sets whether the history of the game should be recorded.
571
572        Parameters:
573            build_history (bool): Whether to track the game history. True to record, False to not record.
574        """
575
576        self.build_history = build_history
577
578    def set_winner(self, result: Result, reason: WinReason):
579        """
580        Sets the winner and the reason for the game's outcome.
581
582        Parameters:
583            result (Result): The winner of the game.
584            reason (WinReason): The reason for the outcome.
585        """
586
587        self.winner = result
588        self.win_reason = reason
589
590    def get_winner(self) -> Result:
591        """
592        Returns the winner of the game.
593
594        Returns:
595            (Result): The winner of the game.
596        """
597
598        return self.winner
599
600    def get_win_reason(self) -> str:
601        """
602        Returns the string explaining the reason why the game was won.
603
604        Returns:
605            (str): The reason for the game's outcome.
606        """
607        return self.win_reason
608
609    def get_history(self) -> dict:
610        """
611        Get a dictionary representation for the renderer.
612
613        Returns:
614            (dict): A dictionary representing the game history.
615        """
616        return self.history
617
618    def reverse_perspective(self):
619        """
620        Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa.
621        This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
622        """
623
624        self.eggs_player, self.eggs_enemy = (
625            self.eggs_enemy,
626            self.eggs_player,
627        )
628        self.turds_player, self.turds_enemy = (
629            self.turds_enemy,
630            self.turds_player,
631        )
632
633        self.chicken_player, self.chicken_enemy = (
634            self.chicken_enemy,
635            self.chicken_player,
636        )
637
638        self.player_time, self.enemy_time = self.enemy_time, self.player_time
639        self.turns_left_player, self.turns_left_enemy = self.turns_left_enemy, self.turns_left_player
def manhattan_distance(p1: Tuple[int, int], p2: Tuple[int, int]) -> int: 
16def manhattan_distance(p1: Tuple[int, int], p2: Tuple[int, int]) -> int:
17    return abs(p1[0] - p2[0]) + abs(p1[1] - p2[1])
class Board: 
 20class Board:
 21    """
 22    Board is the representation of the state of the match. It contains
 23    only the state known to the player -- undiscovered trapdoors are not
 24    included in the Board (although found ones are).
 25
 26    Any coordinates should be given to the board in the form of x, y.
 27
 28    Check_validity is on by default for most functions, but slows
 29    down execution. If a player is confident their actions are valid,
 30    they can directly apply turns and moves with check_validity as false.
 31
 32    Be wary that invalid actions/turns could lead to functions throwing
 33    errors, so make sure to handle them with a try/except in case so that
 34    your program doesn't crash. If an apply function throws an error,
 35    it is not guarenteed that the board state will be valid or that the state
 36    will be the same as when the function started.
 37    """
 38
 39    def __init__(
 40        self,
 41        game_map: GameMap,
 42        time_to_play: float = 20,
 43        build_history: bool = False,
 44        copy: bool = False,
 45    ):
 46        """
 47        Initializes the board with the specified game map and configuration options.
 48
 49        Parameters:
 50            game_map (game_map.GameMap): The map representing the game environment.
 51            time_to_play (float, optional): The time limit for the game in seconds. Defaults to 20.
 52            build_history (bool, optional): Whether to track the history of the game. Defaults to False.
 53            copy (bool, optional): Whether to initialize a copy of the game game_map. Defaults to False.
 54        """
 55
 56        self.game_map = game_map
 57
 58        if not copy:
 59            self.eggs_player = set()
 60            self.eggs_enemy = set()
 61            self.turds_player = set()
 62            self.turds_enemy = set()
 63
 64            # These will get their initial positions and even-ness
 65            # from the gameplay
 66            self.chicken_player = Chicken(self.game_map.MAX_TURDS)
 67            self.chicken_enemy = Chicken(self.game_map.MAX_TURDS)
 68
 69            self.found_trapdoors = set()
 70
 71            # game metadata
 72            self.turn_count = 0
 73
 74            self.MAX_TURNS = 40
 75            self.turns_left_player = self.MAX_TURNS
 76            self.turns_left_enemy = self.MAX_TURNS
 77
 78            # more game metadata
 79            self.winner = None
 80
 81            self.time_to_play = time_to_play
 82            self.player_time = time_to_play
 83            self.enemy_time = time_to_play
 84            self.win_reason = None
 85
 86            self.chicken_blocked = False
 87            self.is_as_turn = True
 88
 89            # history building
 90            self.build_history = build_history
 91            if build_history:
 92                self.history = History()
 93
 94    def is_valid_cell(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
 95        """
 96        Checks if the given coordinates are within the valid board boundaries.
 97
 98        Parameters:
 99            (x, y): The location to check.
100
101        Returns:
102            (bool): True if the cell is valid, False otherwise.
103        """
104        return (
105            loc[0] >= 0
106            and loc[1] >= 0
107            and loc[0] < self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
108            and loc[1] < self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
109        )
110
111    def is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
112        """
113        Checks if a specific cell is within the enemy's turd zone.
114
115        Parameters:
116            loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.
117
118        Returns:
119            (bool): True if the cell is within the enemy's turd zone, False otherwise.
120        """
121        for dir in Direction:
122            new_loc = loc_after_direction(loc, dir)
123            if new_loc in self.turds_enemy:
124                return True
125        if loc in self.turds_enemy:
126            return True
127
128        return False
129
130    def is_cell_blocked(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
131        """
132        Checks if a specific cell is blocked for the given player.
133
134        Parameters:
135            loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.
136
137        Returns:
138            (bool): True if the cell is blocked or occupied by the enemy chicken, False otherwise.
139        """
140        if not self.is_valid_cell(loc):
141            return True
142
143        enemy_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
144        if enemy_loc == loc:
145            return True
146
147        if loc in self.eggs_enemy:
148            return True
149
150        if self.is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(loc):
151            return True
152
153        return False
154
155    def is_valid_direction(self, dir: Direction | int):
156        """
157        Checks if a direction is valid for the given player.
158
159        Parameters:
160            dir (Direction | int): The direction to check.
161
162        Returns:
163            (bool): True if the direction is valid, False otherwise.
164        """
165
166        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
167        next_loc = loc_after_direction(my_loc, dir)
168        return not self.is_cell_blocked(next_loc)
169
170    def is_valid_move(
171        self, dir: Direction | int, move_type: MoveType | int, enemy: bool = False
172    ):
173        """
174        Checks if a move is valid for the given player.
175
176        Parameters:
177            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
178            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
179
180        Returns:
181            (bool): True if the move is valid, False otherwise.
182        """
183
184        if enemy:
185            if move_type == MoveType.TURD and self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left() <= 0:
186                return False
187            test_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
188            opposing_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
189            even_chicken = self.chicken_enemy.even_chicken
190
191        else:
192            if move_type == MoveType.TURD and self.chicken_player.get_turds_left() <= 0:
193                return False
194            test_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
195            opposing_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
196            even_chicken = self.chicken_player.even_chicken
197
198        # Wrong parity?
199        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
200            if (test_loc[0] + test_loc[1]) % 2 != even_chicken:
201                return False
202
203        # Where would it end up?
204        new_loc = loc_after_direction(test_loc, dir)
205
206        # Would that put the chickens on top of each other?
207        if new_loc == opposing_loc:
208            return False
209
210        # Is it off the board?
211        if (
212            new_loc[0] < 0
213            or new_loc[1] < 0
214            or new_loc[0] >= self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
215            or new_loc[1] >= self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
216        ):
217            return False
218
219        # Opposing eggs?
220        if enemy:
221            if new_loc in self.eggs_player:
222                return False
223        else:
224            if new_loc in self.eggs_enemy:
225                return False
226
227        # Opposing turds?
228        if enemy:
229            problematic_turds = self.turds_player
230        else:
231            problematic_turds = self.turds_enemy
232
233        for direction in Direction:
234            adjacent_loc = loc_after_direction(new_loc, direction)
235            if adjacent_loc in problematic_turds:
236                return False
237
238        # Plain move is fine
239        if move_type == MoveType.PLAIN:
240            return True
241
242        # Is anything belonging to the same player already in the square?
243        if enemy:
244            if test_loc in self.eggs_enemy:
245                return False
246            if test_loc in self.turds_enemy:
247                return False
248        else:
249            if test_loc in self.eggs_player:
250                return False
251            if test_loc in self.turds_player:
252                return False
253
254        # If it is an egg laying, we are good to go
255        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
256            return True
257
258        if manhattan_distance(test_loc, opposing_loc) < 2:
259            return False
260
261        return True
262
263    def get_valid_moves(self, enemy: bool = False) -> List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]:
264        """
265        Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.
266
267        Parameters:
268            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.
269
270        Returns:
271            (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.
272        """
273        valid_moves = []
274        for dir in Direction:
275            for move_type in MoveType:
276                if self.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, enemy=enemy):
277                    valid_moves.append((dir, move_type))
278
279        return valid_moves
280
281    def can_lay_egg(self):
282        """
283        Checks if the player can lay an egg at their current location.
284
285        Parameters:
286
287        Returns:
288            (bool): True if an egg can be laid, False otherwise.
289        """
290
291        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
292        return self.can_lay_egg_at_loc(my_loc)
293
294    def can_lay_egg_at_loc(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]):
295        """
296        Checks if the player can lay an egg at a specific location.
297
298        Parameters:
299            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
300            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
301
302        Returns:
303            (bool): True if an egg can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
304        """
305
306        return (
307            self.chicken_player.can_lay_egg(loc)
308            and loc not in self.eggs_player
309            and loc not in self.turds_player
310            and loc not in self.turds_enemy
311        )
312
313    def can_lay_turd(self):
314        """
315        Checks if the player can lay a turd at their current location.
316
317
318        Returns:
319            (bool): True if a turd can be laid, False otherwise.
320        """
321
322        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
323        return self.can_lay_turd_at_loc(my_loc)
324
325    def can_lay_turd_at_loc(self, loc):
326        """
327        Checks if the player can lay a turd at a specific location.
328
329        Parameters:
330            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
331            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
332
333        Returns:
334            (bool): True if a turd can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
335        """
336        enemy_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
337        return (
338            self.chicken_player.has_turds_left()
339            and manhattan_distance(loc, enemy_loc) > 1
340            and loc not in self.turds_player
341            and loc not in self.turds_enemy
342            and loc not in self.eggs_player
343            and loc not in self.eggs_enemy
344        )
345
346    def apply_move(
347        self,
348        dir: Direction | int,
349        move_type: MoveType | int,
350        timer: float = 0,
351        check_ok: bool = True,
352    ):
353        """
354        Applies a move to the board for the specified player.
355
356        Parameters:
357            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
358            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
359            timer (float, optional): Time taken for the move in seconds. Defaults to 0.
360            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.
361
362        Returns:
363            (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.
364        """
365        # TODO: put in try/except
366        # try:
367
368        if check_ok:
369            if not self.is_valid_move(dir, move_type):
370                return False
371
372        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
373        offset = 0 if self.is_as_turn else 2
374
375        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
376            if (my_loc[0] == 0 or my_loc[0] == self.game_map.MAP_SIZE - 1) and (
377                my_loc[1] == 0 or my_loc[1] == self.game_map.MAP_SIZE - 1
378            ):
379                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid(self.game_map.CORNER_REWARD)
380            else:
381                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid()
382            self.eggs_player.add(my_loc)
383
384        elif move_type == MoveType.TURD:
385            self.chicken_player.decrement_turds()
386            self.turds_player.add(my_loc)
387
388        new_loc = self.chicken_player.apply_dir(dir)
389
390        self.end_turn(move_type, timer)
391
392        return True
393        # except:
394        #     return False
395
396    def end_turn(self, move_type: MoveType, timer=0):
397        """
398        Ends the current turn and updates game state.
399
400        Parameters:
401            move_type (MoveType): The type of move that was made.
402            timer (float, optional): Time taken for the turn in seconds. Defaults to 0.
403        """
404        self.turn_count += 1
405        self.turns_left_player -= 1
406        
407        self.player_time -= timer
408
409        if not self.has_moves_left(enemy=True):
410            if self.turns_left_enemy > 0:
411                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid(2)
412                self.chicken_blocked = True
413
414        self.check_win()
415
416        if self.build_history:
417            self.history.record_round_update(
418                self.chicken_player.get_location(),
419                move_type,
420                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid(),
421                self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid(),
422                self.chicken_player.get_turds_left(),
423                self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left(),
424                self.player_time,
425                self.enemy_time,
426                self.turns_left_player,
427                self.turns_left_enemy,
428                self.is_as_turn,
429            )
430            
431        self.is_as_turn = not self.is_as_turn
432
433    def check_win(self, timeout_bounds: float = 0.5):
434        """
435        Checks if the game has been won and sets the winner accordingly.
436
437        Parameters:
438            timeout_bounds (float, optional): The time threshold in seconds for determining timeout ties. Defaults to 0.5.
439        """
440        if self.player_time <= 0:
441            if self.enemy_time <= timeout_bounds:
442                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
443            else:
444                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
445        elif self.enemy_time <= 0:
446            if self.player_time <= timeout_bounds:
447                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
448            else:
449                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
450        elif self.turns_left_player == 0 and self.turns_left_enemy == 0:
451            if self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() < self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid():
452                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
453            elif (
454                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() > self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
455            ):
456                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
457            else:
458                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
459        elif self.chicken_blocked:
460            # seperate condition in case we want to change outcome of blocking win
461            if self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() < self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid():
462                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
463            elif (
464                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() > self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
465            ):
466                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
467            else:
468                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
469
470    def is_game_over(self):
471        """
472        Checks if the game is over.
473
474        Returns:
475            (bool): True if the game is over, False otherwise.
476        """
477        return self.winner is not None
478
479    def forecast_move(
480        self,
481        dir: Direction | int,
482        move_type: MoveType | int,
483        check_ok: bool = True,
484    ):
485        """
486        Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.
487
488        Parameters:
489            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
490            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
491            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.
492
493        Returns:
494            (Board): A new Board object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.
495        """
496        board_copy = self.get_copy()
497        ok = board_copy.apply_move(dir, move_type, check_ok)
498        return board_copy if ok else None
499
500    def set_found_trapdoors(self, found_trapdoors):
501        """
502        Sets a trapdoor at the specified location and updates sampling masks if randomization is enabled.
503
504        Parameters:
505            x (int): The x-coordinate for the trapdoor.
506            y (int): The y-coordinate for the trapdoor.
507        """
508        self.found_trapdoors = set(found_trapdoors)
509
510    def get_copy(
511        self,
512        build_history: bool = False,
513        asymmetric: bool = False,
514    ):
515        """
516        Creates a deep copy of the current board.
517
518        Parameters:
519            build_history (bool, optional): Whether the copy should track history. Defaults to False.
520
521        Returns:
522            (Board): A new Board object with the same state as the current one.
523        """
524        board_copy = Board(self.game_map, build_history=build_history, copy=True)
525
526        board_copy.eggs_player = self.eggs_player.copy()
527        board_copy.eggs_enemy = self.eggs_enemy.copy()
528        board_copy.turds_player = self.turds_player.copy()
529        board_copy.turds_enemy = self.turds_enemy.copy()
530        board_copy.found_trapdoors = self.found_trapdoors.copy()
531        board_copy.is_as_turn = self.is_as_turn
532
533        board_copy.chicken_player = self.chicken_player.get_copy()
534        board_copy.chicken_enemy = self.chicken_enemy.get_copy()
535
536        # game metadata
537        board_copy.turn_count = self.turn_count
538
539        board_copy.MAX_TURNS = self.MAX_TURNS
540        board_copy.turns_left_player = self.turns_left_player
541        board_copy.turns_left_enemy = self.turns_left_enemy
542
543        # more game metadata
544        board_copy.winner = self.winner
545
546        board_copy.time_to_play = self.time_to_play
547        board_copy.player_time = self.player_time
548        board_copy.enemy_time = self.enemy_time
549        board_copy.win_reason = self.win_reason
550        board_copy.chicken_blocked = self.chicken_blocked
551
552        # history building
553        board_copy.build_history = build_history
554        if build_history:
555            board_copy.history = self.history
556
557        return board_copy
558
559    def has_moves_left(self, enemy=False):
560        """
561        Checks if the player has any valid moves remaining.
562
563        Returns:
564            (bool): True if there are valid moves remaining, False otherwise.
565        """
566
567        return len(self.get_valid_moves(enemy=enemy)) > 0
568
569    def set_build_history(self, build_history: bool):
570        """
571        Sets whether the history of the game should be recorded.
572
573        Parameters:
574            build_history (bool): Whether to track the game history. True to record, False to not record.
575        """
576
577        self.build_history = build_history
578
579    def set_winner(self, result: Result, reason: WinReason):
580        """
581        Sets the winner and the reason for the game's outcome.
582
583        Parameters:
584            result (Result): The winner of the game.
585            reason (WinReason): The reason for the outcome.
586        """
587
588        self.winner = result
589        self.win_reason = reason
590
591    def get_winner(self) -> Result:
592        """
593        Returns the winner of the game.
594
595        Returns:
596            (Result): The winner of the game.
597        """
598
599        return self.winner
600
601    def get_win_reason(self) -> str:
602        """
603        Returns the string explaining the reason why the game was won.
604
605        Returns:
606            (str): The reason for the game's outcome.
607        """
608        return self.win_reason
609
610    def get_history(self) -> dict:
611        """
612        Get a dictionary representation for the renderer.
613
614        Returns:
615            (dict): A dictionary representing the game history.
616        """
617        return self.history
618
619    def reverse_perspective(self):
620        """
621        Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa.
622        This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
623        """
624
625        self.eggs_player, self.eggs_enemy = (
626            self.eggs_enemy,
627            self.eggs_player,
628        )
629        self.turds_player, self.turds_enemy = (
630            self.turds_enemy,
631            self.turds_player,
632        )
633
634        self.chicken_player, self.chicken_enemy = (
635            self.chicken_enemy,
636            self.chicken_player,
637        )
638
639        self.player_time, self.enemy_time = self.enemy_time, self.player_time
640        self.turns_left_player, self.turns_left_enemy = self.turns_left_enemy, self.turns_left_player

Board is the representation of the state of the match. It contains only the state known to the player -- undiscovered trapdoors are not included in the Board (although found ones are).

Any coordinates should be given to the board in the form of x, y.

Check_validity is on by default for most functions, but slows down execution. If a player is confident their actions are valid, they can directly apply turns and moves with check_validity as false.

Be wary that invalid actions/turns could lead to functions throwing errors, so make sure to handle them with a try/except in case so that your program doesn't crash. If an apply function throws an error, it is not guarenteed that the board state will be valid or that the state will be the same as when the function started.

Board( game_map: game.game_map.GameMap, time_to_play: float = 20, build_history: bool = False, copy: bool = False) 
39    def __init__(
40        self,
41        game_map: GameMap,
42        time_to_play: float = 20,
43        build_history: bool = False,
44        copy: bool = False,
45    ):
46        """
47        Initializes the board with the specified game map and configuration options.
48
49        Parameters:
50            game_map (game_map.GameMap): The map representing the game environment.
51            time_to_play (float, optional): The time limit for the game in seconds. Defaults to 20.
52            build_history (bool, optional): Whether to track the history of the game. Defaults to False.
53            copy (bool, optional): Whether to initialize a copy of the game game_map. Defaults to False.
54        """
55
56        self.game_map = game_map
57
58        if not copy:
59            self.eggs_player = set()
60            self.eggs_enemy = set()
61            self.turds_player = set()
62            self.turds_enemy = set()
63
64            # These will get their initial positions and even-ness
65            # from the gameplay
66            self.chicken_player = Chicken(self.game_map.MAX_TURDS)
67            self.chicken_enemy = Chicken(self.game_map.MAX_TURDS)
68
69            self.found_trapdoors = set()
70
71            # game metadata
72            self.turn_count = 0
73
74            self.MAX_TURNS = 40
75            self.turns_left_player = self.MAX_TURNS
76            self.turns_left_enemy = self.MAX_TURNS
77
78            # more game metadata
79            self.winner = None
80
81            self.time_to_play = time_to_play
82            self.player_time = time_to_play
83            self.enemy_time = time_to_play
84            self.win_reason = None
85
86            self.chicken_blocked = False
87            self.is_as_turn = True
88
89            # history building
90            self.build_history = build_history
91            if build_history:
92                self.history = History()

def is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool: 
111    def is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
112        """
113        Checks if a specific cell is within the enemy's turd zone.
114
115        Parameters:
116            loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.
117
118        Returns:
119            (bool): True if the cell is within the enemy's turd zone, False otherwise.
120        """
121        for dir in Direction:
122            new_loc = loc_after_direction(loc, dir)
123            if new_loc in self.turds_enemy:
124                return True
125        if loc in self.turds_enemy:
126            return True
127
128        return False

Checks if a specific cell is within the enemy's turd zone.

Parameters: loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.

Returns: (bool): True if the cell is within the enemy's turd zone, False otherwise.

def is_cell_blocked(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool: 
130    def is_cell_blocked(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]) -> bool:
131        """
132        Checks if a specific cell is blocked for the given player.
133
134        Parameters:
135            loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.
136
137        Returns:
138            (bool): True if the cell is blocked or occupied by the enemy chicken, False otherwise.
139        """
140        if not self.is_valid_cell(loc):
141            return True
142
143        enemy_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
144        if enemy_loc == loc:
145            return True
146
147        if loc in self.eggs_enemy:
148            return True
149
150        if self.is_cell_in_enemy_turd_zone(loc):
151            return True
152
153        return False

Checks if a specific cell is blocked for the given player.

Parameters: loc: The (x,y) location of the cell.

Returns: (bool): True if the cell is blocked or occupied by the enemy chicken, False otherwise.

def is_valid_direction(self, dir: game.enums.Direction | int): 
155    def is_valid_direction(self, dir: Direction | int):
156        """
157        Checks if a direction is valid for the given player.
158
159        Parameters:
160            dir (Direction | int): The direction to check.
161
162        Returns:
163            (bool): True if the direction is valid, False otherwise.
164        """
165
166        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
167        next_loc = loc_after_direction(my_loc, dir)
168        return not self.is_cell_blocked(next_loc)

Checks if a direction is valid for the given player.

Parameters: dir (Direction | int): The direction to check.

Returns: (bool): True if the direction is valid, False otherwise.

def is_valid_move( self, dir: game.enums.Direction | int, move_type: game.enums.MoveType | int, enemy: bool = False): 
170    def is_valid_move(
171        self, dir: Direction | int, move_type: MoveType | int, enemy: bool = False
172    ):
173        """
174        Checks if a move is valid for the given player.
175
176        Parameters:
177            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
178            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
179
180        Returns:
181            (bool): True if the move is valid, False otherwise.
182        """
183
184        if enemy:
185            if move_type == MoveType.TURD and self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left() <= 0:
186                return False
187            test_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
188            opposing_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
189            even_chicken = self.chicken_enemy.even_chicken
190
191        else:
192            if move_type == MoveType.TURD and self.chicken_player.get_turds_left() <= 0:
193                return False
194            test_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
195            opposing_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
196            even_chicken = self.chicken_player.even_chicken
197
198        # Wrong parity?
199        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
200            if (test_loc[0] + test_loc[1]) % 2 != even_chicken:
201                return False
202
203        # Where would it end up?
204        new_loc = loc_after_direction(test_loc, dir)
205
206        # Would that put the chickens on top of each other?
207        if new_loc == opposing_loc:
208            return False
209
210        # Is it off the board?
211        if (
212            new_loc[0] < 0
213            or new_loc[1] < 0
214            or new_loc[0] >= self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
215            or new_loc[1] >= self.game_map.MAP_SIZE
216        ):
217            return False
218
219        # Opposing eggs?
220        if enemy:
221            if new_loc in self.eggs_player:
222                return False
223        else:
224            if new_loc in self.eggs_enemy:
225                return False
226
227        # Opposing turds?
228        if enemy:
229            problematic_turds = self.turds_player
230        else:
231            problematic_turds = self.turds_enemy
232
233        for direction in Direction:
234            adjacent_loc = loc_after_direction(new_loc, direction)
235            if adjacent_loc in problematic_turds:
236                return False
237
238        # Plain move is fine
239        if move_type == MoveType.PLAIN:
240            return True
241
242        # Is anything belonging to the same player already in the square?
243        if enemy:
244            if test_loc in self.eggs_enemy:
245                return False
246            if test_loc in self.turds_enemy:
247                return False
248        else:
249            if test_loc in self.eggs_player:
250                return False
251            if test_loc in self.turds_player:
252                return False
253
254        # If it is an egg laying, we are good to go
255        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
256            return True
257
258        if manhattan_distance(test_loc, opposing_loc) < 2:
259            return False
260
261        return True

Checks if a move is valid for the given player.

Parameters: dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move. move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).

Returns: (bool): True if the move is valid, False otherwise.

def get_valid_moves( self, enemy: bool = False) -> List[Tuple[game.enums.Direction, game.enums.MoveType]]: 
263    def get_valid_moves(self, enemy: bool = False) -> List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]:
264        """
265        Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.
266
267        Parameters:
268            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.
269
270        Returns:
271            (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.
272        """
273        valid_moves = []
274        for dir in Direction:
275            for move_type in MoveType:
276                if self.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, enemy=enemy):
277                    valid_moves.append((dir, move_type))
278
279        return valid_moves

Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.

Parameters: enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.

Returns: (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.

def can_lay_egg(self): 
281    def can_lay_egg(self):
282        """
283        Checks if the player can lay an egg at their current location.
284
285        Parameters:
286
287        Returns:
288            (bool): True if an egg can be laid, False otherwise.
289        """
290
291        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
292        return self.can_lay_egg_at_loc(my_loc)

Checks if the player can lay an egg at their current location.

Parameters:

Returns: (bool): True if an egg can be laid, False otherwise.

def can_lay_egg_at_loc(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]): 
294    def can_lay_egg_at_loc(self, loc: Tuple[int, int]):
295        """
296        Checks if the player can lay an egg at a specific location.
297
298        Parameters:
299            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
300            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
301
302        Returns:
303            (bool): True if an egg can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
304        """
305
306        return (
307            self.chicken_player.can_lay_egg(loc)
308            and loc not in self.eggs_player
309            and loc not in self.turds_player
310            and loc not in self.turds_enemy
311        )

Checks if the player can lay an egg at a specific location.

Parameters: x (int): The x-coordinate of the location. y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.

Returns: (bool): True if an egg can be laid at that location, False otherwise.

def can_lay_turd(self): 
313    def can_lay_turd(self):
314        """
315        Checks if the player can lay a turd at their current location.
316
317
318        Returns:
319            (bool): True if a turd can be laid, False otherwise.
320        """
321
322        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
323        return self.can_lay_turd_at_loc(my_loc)

Checks if the player can lay a turd at their current location.

def can_lay_turd_at_loc(self, loc): 
325    def can_lay_turd_at_loc(self, loc):
326        """
327        Checks if the player can lay a turd at a specific location.
328
329        Parameters:
330            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
331            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
332
333        Returns:
334            (bool): True if a turd can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
335        """
336        enemy_loc = self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
337        return (
338            self.chicken_player.has_turds_left()
339            and manhattan_distance(loc, enemy_loc) > 1
340            and loc not in self.turds_player
341            and loc not in self.turds_enemy
342            and loc not in self.eggs_player
343            and loc not in self.eggs_enemy
344        )

Checks if the player can lay a turd at a specific location.

Parameters: x (int): The x-coordinate of the location. y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.

Returns: (bool): True if a turd can be laid at that location, False otherwise.

def apply_move( self, dir: game.enums.Direction | int, move_type: game.enums.MoveType | int, timer: float = 0, check_ok: bool = True): 
346    def apply_move(
347        self,
348        dir: Direction | int,
349        move_type: MoveType | int,
350        timer: float = 0,
351        check_ok: bool = True,
352    ):
353        """
354        Applies a move to the board for the specified player.
355
356        Parameters:
357            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
358            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
359            timer (float, optional): Time taken for the move in seconds. Defaults to 0.
360            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.
361
362        Returns:
363            (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.
364        """
365        # TODO: put in try/except
366        # try:
367
368        if check_ok:
369            if not self.is_valid_move(dir, move_type):
370                return False
371
372        my_loc = self.chicken_player.get_location()
373        offset = 0 if self.is_as_turn else 2
374
375        if move_type == MoveType.EGG:
376            if (my_loc[0] == 0 or my_loc[0] == self.game_map.MAP_SIZE - 1) and (
377                my_loc[1] == 0 or my_loc[1] == self.game_map.MAP_SIZE - 1
378            ):
379                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid(self.game_map.CORNER_REWARD)
380            else:
381                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid()
382            self.eggs_player.add(my_loc)
383
384        elif move_type == MoveType.TURD:
385            self.chicken_player.decrement_turds()
386            self.turds_player.add(my_loc)
387
388        new_loc = self.chicken_player.apply_dir(dir)
389
390        self.end_turn(move_type, timer)
391
392        return True
393        # except:
394        #     return False

Applies a move to the board for the specified player.

Parameters: dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move. move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd). timer (float, optional): Time taken for the move in seconds. Defaults to 0. check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.

Returns: (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.

def end_turn(self, move_type: game.enums.MoveType, timer=0): 
396    def end_turn(self, move_type: MoveType, timer=0):
397        """
398        Ends the current turn and updates game state.
399
400        Parameters:
401            move_type (MoveType): The type of move that was made.
402            timer (float, optional): Time taken for the turn in seconds. Defaults to 0.
403        """
404        self.turn_count += 1
405        self.turns_left_player -= 1
406        
407        self.player_time -= timer
408
409        if not self.has_moves_left(enemy=True):
410            if self.turns_left_enemy > 0:
411                self.chicken_player.increment_eggs_laid(2)
412                self.chicken_blocked = True
413
414        self.check_win()
415
416        if self.build_history:
417            self.history.record_round_update(
418                self.chicken_player.get_location(),
419                move_type,
420                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid(),
421                self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid(),
422                self.chicken_player.get_turds_left(),
423                self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left(),
424                self.player_time,
425                self.enemy_time,
426                self.turns_left_player,
427                self.turns_left_enemy,
428                self.is_as_turn,
429            )
430            
431        self.is_as_turn = not self.is_as_turn

Ends the current turn and updates game state.

Parameters: move_type (MoveType): The type of move that was made. timer (float, optional): Time taken for the turn in seconds. Defaults to 0.

def check_win(self, timeout_bounds: float = 0.5): 
433    def check_win(self, timeout_bounds: float = 0.5):
434        """
435        Checks if the game has been won and sets the winner accordingly.
436
437        Parameters:
438            timeout_bounds (float, optional): The time threshold in seconds for determining timeout ties. Defaults to 0.5.
439        """
440        if self.player_time <= 0:
441            if self.enemy_time <= timeout_bounds:
442                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
443            else:
444                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
445        elif self.enemy_time <= 0:
446            if self.player_time <= timeout_bounds:
447                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
448            else:
449                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.TIMEOUT)
450        elif self.turns_left_player == 0 and self.turns_left_enemy == 0:
451            if self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() < self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid():
452                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
453            elif (
454                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() > self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
455            ):
456                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
457            else:
458                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.EGGS_LAID)
459        elif self.chicken_blocked:
460            # seperate condition in case we want to change outcome of blocking win
461            if self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() < self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid():
462                self.set_winner(Result.ENEMY, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
463            elif (
464                self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid() > self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
465            ):
466                self.set_winner(Result.PLAYER, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)
467            else:
468                self.set_winner(Result.TIE, WinReason.BLOCKING_END)

Checks if the game has been won and sets the winner accordingly.

Parameters: timeout_bounds (float, optional): The time threshold in seconds for determining timeout ties. Defaults to 0.5.

def is_game_over(self): 
470    def is_game_over(self):
471        """
472        Checks if the game is over.
473
474        Returns:
475            (bool): True if the game is over, False otherwise.
476        """
477        return self.winner is not None

Checks if the game is over.

Returns: (bool): True if the game is over, False otherwise.

def forecast_move( self, dir: game.enums.Direction | int, move_type: game.enums.MoveType | int, check_ok: bool = True): 
479    def forecast_move(
480        self,
481        dir: Direction | int,
482        move_type: MoveType | int,
483        check_ok: bool = True,
484    ):
485        """
486        Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.
487
488        Parameters:
489            dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move.
490            move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd).
491            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.
492
493        Returns:
494            (Board): A new Board object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.
495        """
496        board_copy = self.get_copy()
497        ok = board_copy.apply_move(dir, move_type, check_ok)
498        return board_copy if ok else None

Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.

Parameters: dir (Direction | int): The direction of the move. move_type (MoveType | int): The type of move (walk, egg, turd). check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. Defaults to True.

Returns: (Board): A new Board object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.

501        """

503
504        Parameters:

Sets a trapdoor at the specified location and updates sampling masks if randomization is enabled.

Parameters: x (int): The x-coordinate for the trapdoor. y (int): The y-coordinate for the trapdoor.

def get_copy(self, build_history: bool = False, asymmetric: bool = False): 
510    def get_copy(
511        self,
512        build_history: bool = False,
513        asymmetric: bool = False,
514    ):
515        """
516        Creates a deep copy of the current board.
517
518        Parameters:
519            build_history (bool, optional): Whether the copy should track history. Defaults to False.
520
521        Returns:
522            (Board): A new Board object with the same state as the current one.
523        """
524        board_copy = Board(self.game_map, build_history=build_history, copy=True)
525
526        board_copy.eggs_player = self.eggs_player.copy()
527        board_copy.eggs_enemy = self.eggs_enemy.copy()
528        board_copy.turds_player = self.turds_player.copy()
529        board_copy.turds_enemy = self.turds_enemy.copy()
530        board_copy.found_trapdoors = self.found_trapdoors.copy()
531        board_copy.is_as_turn = self.is_as_turn
532
533        board_copy.chicken_player = self.chicken_player.get_copy()
534        board_copy.chicken_enemy = self.chicken_enemy.get_copy()
535
536        # game metadata
537        board_copy.turn_count = self.turn_count
538
539        board_copy.MAX_TURNS = self.MAX_TURNS
540        board_copy.turns_left_player = self.turns_left_player
541        board_copy.turns_left_enemy = self.turns_left_enemy
542
543        # more game metadata
544        board_copy.winner = self.winner
545
546        board_copy.time_to_play = self.time_to_play
547        board_copy.player_time = self.player_time
548        board_copy.enemy_time = self.enemy_time
549        board_copy.win_reason = self.win_reason
550        board_copy.chicken_blocked = self.chicken_blocked
551
552        # history building
553        board_copy.build_history = build_history
554        if build_history:
555            board_copy.history = self.history
556
557        return board_copy

Creates a deep copy of the current board.

Parameters: build_history (bool, optional): Whether the copy should track history. Defaults to False.

Returns: (Board): A new Board object with the same state as the current one.

def reverse_perspective(self): 
619    def reverse_perspective(self):
620        """
621        Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa.
622        This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
623        """
624
625        self.eggs_player, self.eggs_enemy = (
626            self.eggs_enemy,
627            self.eggs_player,
628        )
629        self.turds_player, self.turds_enemy = (
630            self.turds_enemy,
631            self.turds_player,
632        )
633
634        self.chicken_player, self.chicken_enemy = (
635            self.chicken_enemy,
636            self.chicken_player,
637        )
638
639        self.player_time, self.enemy_time = self.enemy_time, self.player_time
640        self.turns_left_player, self.turns_left_enemy = self.turns_left_enemy, self.turns_left_player

Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa. This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
